channel.title: Comments on: Using ClusterJPA (part of MySQL Cluster Connector for Java) â€“ a tutorial
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: jelramzy
item.dc:creator: jelramzy
item.description:
Excellent!
Thank you for the tutorial. I sthere any thing similar to show how to access the cluster using the NDB API ?
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Excellent!

Thank you for the tutorial.
I sthere any thing similar to show how to access the cluster using the NDB API ?

item.title: By: Marton
item.dc:creator: Marton
item.description:
Hi,
What could be the problem if after persistence.xml file is read the following exception is occured: Exception in thread "Thread-0" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.openjpa.l ib.conf.IntValue.get()I at com.mysql.clusterj.openjpa.NdbOpenJPAConfigurationImpl.getConnectDela y(NdbOpenJPAConfigurationImpl.java:155)
Is it possible that clusterj-7.1.3.jar clusterj-api-7.1.3.jar clusterjpa-7.1.3.jar openjpa-all-2.0.0-beta3.jar (and MySQL Cluster 7.1.3)
are not compatible somehow? (I tried with openjpa-all-2.0.0.jar also) I tried with the above mentioned Example also.
thanks Marton
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

What could be the problem if after persistence.xml file is read the following exception is occured:
Exception in thread “Thread-0” java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.openjpa.l
ib.conf.IntValue.get()I
at com.mysql.clusterj.openjpa.NdbOpenJPAConfigurationImpl.getConnectDela
y(NdbOpenJPAConfigurationImpl.java:155)

Is it possible that
clusterj-7.1.3.jar
clusterj-api-7.1.3.jar
clusterjpa-7.1.3.jar
openjpa-all-2.0.0-beta3.jar
(and MySQL Cluster 7.1.3)

are not compatible somehow? (I tried with openjpa-all-2.0.0.jar also)
I tried with the above mentioned Example also.

thanks
Marton

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../using-clusterjpa-part-of-mysql-cluster-connector-for-java-a-tutorial/index.html#comment-392">Edwin Biemond</a>.
There is no date for when an NDB API plugin will be developed for TopLink but of course you can use it with MySQL Cluster already - it's just that it will go through the JDBC/MySQL Server path and so the performance probably won't be as good.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Edwin Biemond.

There is no date for when an NDB API plugin will be developed for TopLink but of course you can use it with MySQL Cluster already – it’s just that it will go through the JDBC/MySQL Server path and so the performance probably won’t be as good.

item.title: By: Edwin Biemond
item.dc:creator: Edwin Biemond
item.description:
Hi,
Looks really nice, I am now using cluster 7.0 and with eclipselink and weblogic. Do you know when eclipselink / toplink JPA will be supported.
Then I will upgrade mysql to 7.1 and skip the jdbc / mysql node layer
thanks Edwin
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

Looks really nice, I am now using cluster 7.0 and with eclipselink and weblogic. Do you know when eclipselink / toplink JPA will be supported.

Then I will upgrade mysql to 7.1 and skip the jdbc / mysql node layer

thanks Edwin
